short_summary: Bidders must possess marine window products with specific qualities and functions.

full_summary:
# Tender Announcement: Windows for Marine Craft Systems

**Accession Number**: cb-716-46670789
**Contracting Authority**: Department of National Defence
**Procurement Reference Number**: W8482-231049/C

## Overview

The Department of National Defence invites bids from eligible suppliers to provide windows for marine craft systems. The tender includes the supply of 16 different types of windows to be delivered to Canadian Forces Bases (CFB) Halifax, Nova Scotia, and CFB Esquimalt, British Columbia.

## Tender Description

The tender particulars include the following:

- **Marine Craft Systems Windows**: Total quantity of 60 units, consisting of 16 different types, to be delivered within 6 months from the contract kickoff date.
- The windows are for various models of marine craft, provided in the tender notice.
- The specifications for each window type are detailed in the tender documents.

## Tender Requirements

Bidders must meet the following requirements:
- **Trade Agreements**: Suppliers must be prepared to comply with the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA), multinational tenders, or single bid procedures.
- **Goods and Services**: Suppliers are expected to comply with regulations for shipments to the Armed Forces, which include nuclear, biological, chemical, and explosive ordnance (NBC/EO) exemption, when required.

## Evaluation Criteria

The proposal will be evaluated on the following criteria:

- **Price**: The lowest valid tender will be selected for award.
- **Quality**: Suppliers must demonstrate fulfillment of all specifications and requirements detailed in the tender notice and attachment.
- **Services and Goods Compliance**: Suppliers must meet all regulations and mandates for the provision of NBC/EO exemption when required.

## Substitution and Equivalent Products

Bidders proposing to supply equivalent or substitute products must clearly indicate the brand name, model, and/or part number, along with the National Codification of Commercial Objects under OSCO (NOCO).

## Documents and Attachments

The tender notice, amendment, and all supporting documents are available on the Canadabuys Ontario Public work procurement website.  **http://canadabuys.on.ca **
**overview4_732_pdf.pdf**: Note the PDF added

## Contact Information

Katharine Barker, contract specialist

E-mail: katharine.barker2@forces.gc.ca
Telephone: (343) 598-6913
